The population of Moscow is approximately 12.4 million.
In rural Russia, villages often have a mix of one-story houses with gardens and 4–5 story apartment blocks.
Infrastructure in rural Russia is highly modern and uniform across the country.
Common vegetables grown in Russian village gardens include potatoes, carrots, and zucchini.
Summer houses in rural Russia usually have farm animals.

Who is considered the founder of the first Russian state?
The Rurik dynasty ruled Russia for approximately 740 years.
Rurik himself was not ethnically Russian.
Rurik’s brothers controlled nearby regions while he ruled Novgorod.
The 'land of the Rus' refers to the early state founded by Rurik.
Traditional early Russian way of life emphasized agriculture, hunting, and beekeeping.
Defending land was a frequent necessity in early Russia.
Which Russian prince converted to Christianity in 988 to unify his people?
Vladimir of Kiev explored multiple religions before choosing Eastern Orthodox Christianity.
The Christianization of Kievan Rus’ started from the top, with elites converting first.
Christianity in Kievan Rus’ was primarily adopted to unify the population under the prince’s authority.
The Golden Horde demanded tribute from Russian princes and publicly humiliated them.
Ivan III restricted peasants' movement and centralized power in Moscow.
Ivan III was the first Tsar of Russia.
Ivan IV (Ivan the Terrible) was the first official Tsar of Russia.
Ivan IV conquered Kazan in 1552 and Astrakhan in 1556, opening expansion into non-Slavic territories.
Ivan IV created the Oprichnina, which included public executions and seizure of boyar property.
Ivan IV modernized government by appointing advisors based on merit.
Ivan IV died without an heir.
